item.title: [BOOKKEEPER-376] LedgerManagers should consider 'underreplication' node as a special Znode
item.description:
Saw this while running the RW tests:

2012-08-22 23:59:35,649 - WARN  - [GarbageCollectorThread:HierarchicalLedgerManager@354] - Exception during garbage collecting ledgers for underreplication of /ledgers
java.io.IOException: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "underreplicationlocks0000"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Issue in FlatLedgerManager also.

2012-08-25 00:10:14,904 - WARN  - [main-EventThread:AbstractZkLedgerManager$5@235] - Error extracting ledgerId from ZK ledger node: underreplication
2012-08-25 00:10:15,066 - WARN  - [main-EventThread:AbstractZkLedgerManager$5@235] - Error extracting ledgerId from ZK ledger node: underreplication

Problem here is, we did not add the check for UnderReplication znode in AbstractZkLedgerManager#isSpecialZNode

Straight fix would be to add UnderReplicationZnode check in AbstractZkLedgerManager#isSpecialZNode
RW test will have lot of warn logs with the above trace, they all go away now with this patch. did not put any special test.

@Uma, could you make 'underreplication' as a constant define in ZkLedgerUnderreplicationManager? since it would be used over several files (like AbstractZkLedgerManager, ZkLedgerUnderreplicationManager, some test files).

Thanks Sijie, for the review!

Sure, I can make that. Infact I thought to make that, again I looked at code for other consts, they are kept in AbstractZkLedgerManager itself. So, I just left that comment myself. Since you pointed that, I can make it.
@Sijie, Attached a new Patch which addresses your comments.

thanks Uma. +1 for the new patch.

will commit it now.
committed as r1378103. thanks Uma for the patch.

Integrated in bookkeeper-trunk #678 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/bookkeeper-trunk/678/)
